episode_summary: This episode of 'No Such Thing As A Fish' covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the unique locomotion of kangaroos, a bizarre historical punishment involving stockbrokers and snakes, the surprising number of estate agents compared to soldiers in the UK, and the mysterious medieval illustrations of knights battling snails.

facts.fact: Kangaroos have three or five legs, depending on how you look at it, as their tail counts as a leg according to a new study.
During the financial crisis of 1720, Parliament called upon stockbrokers to be sewn into sacks filled with poisonous snakes and thrown into the Thames.
There are three times as many estate agents in the UK as there are members of the armed forces.
Medieval manuscripts are littered with drawings of warfare between snails and knights, and the amazing thing is no one knows why, it's a total mystery.
